This type of attack is when a hacker gains control of a large number of compromised computers, which they then use to flood the target system (in this case, the power grid) with traffic, thereby disrupting its operation.

There are several other methods that hackers use to target power grids, including exploiting vulnerabilities in SCADA (supervisory control and data acquisition) systems, which are used to monitor and control the operation of power grids.
